title: efrit-agent: Not available in autoload list
description:
efrit-agent module exists and loads when dependencies are available, but it's not registered in the autoload list in efrit.el. This means:

1. M-x efrit-agent won't work without (require 'efrit-agent)
2. The new agent buffer support isn't accessible to users
3. It's inconsistent with how efrit-chat, efrit-do, etc. are exposed

The module at lisp/interfaces/efrit-agent.el has a public function efrit-agent but no autoload declaration in efrit.el.
close_reason: Added efrit-agent to autoload list in efrit.el, also added to keybindings and help text

title: efrit-chat: efrit-send-message fails when called programmatically
description:
When calling efrit-send-message programmatically (not via M-x), the message parameter is nil, causing "Wrong type argument: stringp, nil" error. This breaks batch testing and programmatic use of efrit-chat.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create efrit-chat buffer
2. Call (efrit-send-message "test message") directly
Result: Error - message is nil
Expected: Message is sent to API

The issue is that when called non-interactively, the message parameter isn't being bound properly.
close_reason: Fixed by making efrit-chat return the buffer it creates and sets up

title: efrit-agent: Major mode not initialized when buffer is created
description:
The efrit-agent() function had inverted logic - it only activated efrit-agent-mode when the buffer was NOT live, but get-buffer-create always creates a live buffer. Result: efrit-agent buffer was in fundamental-mode instead of efrit-agent-mode.

Fixed by checking major-mode instead of buffer-live-p.
close_reason: Fixed by checking major-mode instead of buffer-live-p

title: efrit-chat: API returns 404 error on message send
description:
When using efrit-chat and sending messages, API requests fail with HTTP 404 error. This blocks interactive chat usage.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Call efrit-chat
2. Send a message with (efrit-send-message "...")
Result: HTTP 404 error
Expected: Message is sent and response is received

Note: efrit-do works correctly with the same API key and configuration, so the issue is specific to efrit-chat's API request handling, possibly in the URL construction or endpoint path.
